intro: Marsdenia globifera, commonly known as the globe-shaped Marsdenia, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asclepiadaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, followed by distinctive, spherical fruits. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
